data.question: What is the chemical formula for MFM-303(Al) as reported in the synthesis section?
data.answer: The chemical formula for MFM-303(Al) is [Al­(OH)­(C16O8H8)]­(H2O)2.

data.question: What method was used to collect single crystal X-ray diffraction data of MFM-303(Al)?
data.answer: Single crystal X-ray diffraction data of MFM-303(Al) were collected using synchrotron radiation at Beamline I19 of Diamond Light Source.

data.question: How was the NH3 adsorption capacity of MFM-303(Al) determined under dynamic conditions?
data.answer: The NH3 adsorption capacity of MFM-303(Al) under dynamic conditions was determined using breakthrough experiments with a flow of NH3 diluted in He at atmospheric pressure.

data.question: What was the role of free −COOH and −OH groups in MFM-303(Al) according to the study?
data.answer: The free −COOH and −OH groups in MFM-303(Al) played a critical role in immobilizing NH3 molecules, contributing to its exceptional packing density.

data.question: True or False: The adsorption isotherms for NH3 in MFM-303(Al) showed a stepped increase due to framework transitions similar to MIL-53(Al).
data.answer: False. The steps in the isotherms for MFM-303(Al) are less pronounced, suggesting relatively minor structural distortion or rearrangement of adsorbed NH3 molecules within the pore, not framework transitions.

data.question: What experimental technique was used to confirm the excellent performance of MFM-303(Al) for NH3 capture under both dry and wet conditions?
data.answer: Breakthrough experiments confirmed the excellent performance of MFM-303(Al) for NH3 capture under both dry and wet conditions.

data.question: True or False: MFM-303(Al) demonstrated a higher NH3 uptake at 273 K compared to MFM-300(Al).
data.answer: False. Although MFM-303(Al) has a lower NH3 uptake than MFM-300(Al) at 273 K, it results in a more efficient packing of NH3 molecules.

data.question: What was the primary binding site of NH3 in MFM-303(Al) and how was it characterized?
data.answer: The primary binding site of NH3 in MFM-303(Al) was located within the longer arms of the star and was characterized by Rietveld refinement of synchrotron powder X-ray diffraction data.

data.question: True or False: The dynamic uptake capacity of NH3 in MFM-303(Al) is significantly reduced under humid conditions.
data.answer: True. The dynamic adsorption capacity of NH3 was reduced from 2.9 mmol g−1 under dry conditions to 2.4 mmol g−1 under humid conditions.

data.question: How was the structure of NH3-loaded MFM-303(Al) investigated to understand the host-guest binding dynamics?
data.answer: The structure of NH3-loaded MFM-303(Al) was investigated using in situ synchrotron powder X-ray diffraction and inelastic neutron scattering coupled with computational modeling.
